private_information: Can only pick up and place blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can only pick top blocks of stacks
vowel_agent.goal: Help achieve the goal block configuration by moving vowel blocks (A, E, I) while respecting constraints.

private_information: Can only pick up and place blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can only pick top blocks of stacks
consonant_agent.goal: Help achieve the goal block configuration by moving consonant blocks (B, C, D, F, G) while respecting constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that coordinates the vowel_agent and consonant_agent to transform the initial stacks into the goal stacks under the given constraints.

public_information: There are 8 uniquely identified blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I.
At most 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time.
Only top blocks of stacks can be picked up.
Agents may hold at most one block at a time.
Vowel-Agent handles A, E, I. Consonant-Agent handles B, C, D, F, G.
An agent may place a held block on top of any existing stack or on the table (to start a new stack) provided the table stack count limit is respected.
An agent cannot place a block on top of a block that is currently being held by the other agent.
No other moves are allowed (no splitting, no moving multiple blocks at once, no moving non-top blocks).

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. You will be given the environment initial state, the goal, and private constraints for two agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent). Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the integrated multi-agent block rearrangement task. Ensure actions are clearly assigned to the appropriate agent (vowel_agent or consonant_agent). Encode constraints: top-only moves, single-block holding per agent, agent-specific block access, max 3 table stacks, cannot place on a block held by the other agent, and only single-block moves. Keep concurrency possible by modeling which actions may be simultaneous but do not include execution schedules. Return only the PDDL domain and problem files enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The vowel_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->vowel_agent->private_information}.
The consonant_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->consonant_agent->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
